meanings.definition: A person with myopia, or nearsightedness.
meanings.sent1: Many myopes wear glasses to see things clearly up close.
meanings.sent2: The eye doctor specializes in helping myopes improve their vision.
meanings.sent3: A group of myopes tried to read a sign from far away but couldn't see it.
meanings.sent4: The myopes in the room only noticed the details right in front of them.
meanings.sent5: The myopes in the class struggled to see the whiteboard without squinting.

meanings.definition: Plural form of myope, referring to individuals with nearsightedness.
meanings.sent1: The optometrist examined several myopes and prescribed glasses for each one.
meanings.sent2: The myopes in the family all had trouble reading road signs while driving.
meanings.sent3: The group of myopes at the party all had to sit close to the TV to watch a movie.
meanings.sent4: The myopes in the crowd could only see clearly within a short distance.
meanings.sent5: The myopes on the team struggled to see the ball coming towards them during the game.

meanings.definition: A group of individuals with a limited or narrow view of things.
meanings.sent1: The myopes in the meeting couldn't see the bigger picture of the project.
meanings.sent2: The myopes in the debate only focused on one small aspect of the issue.
meanings.sent3: The myopes in the office argued over minor details instead of seeing the overall goal.
meanings.sent4: The myopes in the community missed out on new opportunities due to their narrow perspective.
meanings.sent5: The myopes in the group couldn't understand the full impact of their decisions.
